infodynamics.measures.discrete
Class EntropyRateCalculator

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculator
      infodynamics.measures.discrete.ContextOfPastMeasureCalculator
          infodynamics.measures.discrete.SingleAgentMeasureInContextOfPastCalculator
              infodynamics.measures.discrete.EntropyRateCalculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
SingleAgentMeasure
public class EntropyRateCalculator
extends SingleAgentMeasureInContextOfPastCalculator

Compute average and local entropy rates Usage: 1. Continuous accumulation of observations: Call: a. initialise() b. addObservations() several times over c. computeLocalFromPreviousObservations() 2. Standalone: Call: localActiveInformation()

Author:
Joseph Lizier

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd and 3rd index give the 2D agent number

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states,
                            int col)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number
col - index of agent

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][][] states,
                            int agentIndex1,
                            int agentIndex2)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd and 3rd index give the 2D agent number
agentIndex1 - first index of agent
agentIndex2 - index of agent in 2nd dimension

public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
Returns the average local active information storage from the observed values which have been passed in previously.

computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

public double[][] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][] states)
Computes local entropy rate for the given states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method This method to be used for homogeneous agents only

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number
